Dear Dave and cantera group,

I am trying to install cantera in my home directory on solaris 2.9
Python is installed on the system, and I have added Numeric-23.1 in my 
home directory, with no problem. I am able to do "from Numeric import *" 
and use the Numeric functions with no errors.

For cantera to even compile it was necessary to make a few changes:

- set the environment varibable CC=gcc
- modify setup.py to also look for header files in the appropriate 
Numeric directory (~/include/python)

I run "./configure --prefix=~/cantera" and then "make" and "make 
install", and there are no error messages.

However, when I start python this is what I get:

 >>> from Cantera import *
Traceback (most recent call last):
   File "<stdin>", line 1, in ?
   File 
"/home/ends/johns3c/cantera/lib/python2.3/site-packages/Cantera/__init__.py", 
line 7, in ?
     from gases import *
   File 
"/home/ends/johns3c/cantera/lib/python2.3/site-packages/Cantera/gases.py", 
line 8, in ?
     import solution, constants, ck2ctml
   File 
"/home/ends/johns3c/cantera/lib/python2.3/site-packages/Cantera/solution.py", 
line 8, in ?
     from ThermoPhase import ThermoPhase
   File 
"/home/ends/johns3c/cantera/lib/python2.3/site-packages/Cantera/ThermoPhase.py", 
line 4, in ?
     from Cantera.Phase import Phase
   File 
"/home/ends/johns3c/cantera/lib/python2.3/site-packages/Cantera/Phase.py", 
line 7, in ?
     import _cantera
ImportError: ld.so.1: python: fatal: relocation error: file 
/home/ends/johns3c/cantera/lib/python2.3/site-packages/Cantera/_cantera.so: 
symbol _ZNSi7putbackEc: referenced symbol not found

Has anyone had any experience installing cantera on solaris?
Any ideas would be helpful.

Thanks,
Michael
